results.name: The s-fusc function s(n) = a(n): a(1) = 0, a(2n) = A287729(n), a(2n+1) = A287729(n) + A287729(n+1).
comment: Define a sequence chf(n) of Christoffel words over an alphabet {-,+}:

Then the length of the chf(n) word is fusc(n) = A002487(n), the number of '-'-signs in the chf(n) word is c-fusc(n) = A287729(n) and the number of '+'-signs in the chf(n) word is the current sequence a(n) = s-fusc(n). See examples below.
link: I. V. Serov (terms 1..1025) & Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8192
Index entries for sequences related to Stern's sequences
formula: The mutual diatomic recurrence pair c(n) (A287729) and s(n) (A288730) are defined by c(1)=1, s(1)=0, c(2n) = s(n), c(2n+1) = s(n)+s(n+1), s(2n) = c(n), s(2n+1) = c(n)+c(n+1).
then a(n) = k(n-1)*a(n-1) - a(n-2) - d(n) for n > 2 with a(1) = 0, a(2) = 1.
program: ;; An implementation of memoization-macro definec can be found for example in: http://oeis.org/wiki/Memoization
;; Second version after the alternative formula given by the author:
def c(n): return 1 if n==1 else s(n//2) if n%2==0 else s((n - 1)//2) + s((n + 1)//2)
def s(n): return 0 if n==1 else c(n//2) if n%2==0 else c((n - 1)//2) + c((n + 1)//2)
print([s(n) for n in range(1, 101)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jun 08 2017
